title: La France Insoumise - Wikipedia
snippet: Beginning in late 2018, Mélenchon and the leadership of La France Insoumise made a significant shift by abandoning their sovereigntist and ultra-secularist stances. This decision led to the expulsion of key members, marking a clear change in the party's ideological direction. The 2022 L'Avenir en commun programme for the Popular Union includes a number of proposals, such as replacing capitalism. In August 2025, during the congress of France Insoumise, in Châteauneuf-sur-Isère, near Valence in the Drôme, the party called for a strike for 10 September 2025, to oppose the 2026 budget bill, presented by François Bayrou.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (LFI et NFP) : actualités, biographie courte
snippet: Aucune synthèse n’a été possible entre la majorité d’Olivier Faure, réélu premier secrétaire du PS, et la minorité représentée par Nicolas Mayer-Rossignol lors du congrès réuni du 13 au 15 juin 2025, à Nancy. title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: Jean-Luc Antoine Pierre Mélenchon (French: [ʒɑ̃lyk melɑ̃ʃɔ̃] ⓘ; born 19 August 1951) is a French politician who has been the de facto leader of the movement La France Insoumise (LFI) since it was established in 2016. He was the deputy in the National Assembly for the 4th constituency of Bouches-du-Rhône from 2017 to 2022 and led the La France Insoumise group in the National Assembly from 2017 to 2021.
